Class com.tektools.kawa.plugin.KawaFile 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----com.tektools.kawa.plugin.KawaObject
           |
           +----com.tektools.kawa.plugin.KawaFile
public class KawaFile
extends KawaObject
This object represents a file in Kawa. A KawaFile can be acquired either by:
  1. Calling KawaProject.enumerateFiles() and going through the list of files.

KawaFile(String)
Creates a KawaFile object from the given path

addListener(KawaEventListener)
Add a KawaEventListener to the list of current listeners.
dispatchEvent(KawaEvent)
Dispatches an event to the registered listeners in KawaFile
getClassNames()
Returns all the class names defined in the file.
getEditor(boolean)
Returns the file opened in an editor.
getInterfaceNames()
Returns all the interface names defined in the file.
getListenersCount()
Return the number of current listeners on KawaFile.
getPackageName()
Returns the package name of the file if any.
getPath()
Returns the path of the file.
getSCMStatus()
Gets the Source control status for the project.
getUserInteger()
Gets the user integer value stored in the file.
getUserString()
Gets the user String value stored in the file.
isDirty()
Checks the compile status of the file.
removeListener(KawaEventListener)
Remove a KawaEventListener from the list of listeners.
setDirty(boolean)
Sets the flag dirty.
setEditorReadOnly(boolean)
Sets the read write state of the file in the editor if open.
setSCMStatus(int)
Sets the Source control status for the project.
setUserInteger(int)
Sets a user integer value in the file.
setUserString(String)
Sets a user String value in the file.
toString()
Returns the path of the file.

KawaFile 
 public KawaFile(String path)
Creates a KawaFile object from the given path

Parameters:
path - Path of the file.

getPath 
 public String getPath()
Returns the path of the file.

Returns:
file path
toString 
 public String toString()
Returns the path of the file.

Returns:
File path
Overrides:
toString in class Object
getEditor 
 public native KawaEditor getEditor(boolean open)
Returns the file opened in an editor. Opens the editor if not already open.

Returns:
KawaEditor.
See Also:
KawaEditor
isDirty 
 public native boolean isDirty()
Checks the compile status of the file. Relevant only if the file is part of the currently open project.

Returns:
true or false
setDirty 
 public native void setDirty(boolean dirty)
Sets the flag dirty. The file has to be part of current open project.

Parameters:
dirty - true or false
setSCMStatus 
 public native void setSCMStatus(int status)
Sets the Source control status for the project. Valid only if the file is part of the current project.

getSCMStatus 
 public native int getSCMStatus()
Gets the Source control status for the project.

setEditorReadOnly 
 public native void setEditorReadOnly(boolean flag)
Sets the read write state of the file in the editor if open. This API could move in the future. This command can be run after a file is checked in or checked out.

Parameters:
flag - true or false
setUserInteger 
 public native boolean setUserInteger(int value)
Sets a user integer value in the file. This can be used for any purposes. The project needs to be open currently. Save the project after setting the value.

Parameters:
integer - value
getUserInteger 
 public native int getUserInteger()
Gets the user integer value stored in the file.

Returns:
integer value
setUserString 
 public native boolean setUserString(String value)
Sets a user String value in the file. This can be used for any purposes. The project needs to be open currently. Save the project after setting the value.

Parameters:
String - value
getUserString 
 public native String getUserString()
Gets the user String value stored in the file.

Returns:
string value
dispatchEvent 
 public static boolean dispatchEvent(KawaEvent event)
Dispatches an event to the registered listeners in KawaFile

getPackageName 
 public native String getPackageName()
Returns the package name of the file if any. This will parse the file and read the package name at the beginning of the file.

Returns:
Package name.
getClassNames 
 public native String[] getClassNames()
Returns all the class names defined in the file. Class names are without package names.

Returns:
class names.
getInterfaceNames 
 public native String[] getInterfaceNames()
Returns all the interface names defined in the file. Interface names are without package names.

Returns:
interface names.
addListener 
 public static void addListener(KawaEventListener newListener)
Add a KawaEventListener to the list of current listeners.

Parameters:
newlistener - A new File listener
removeListener 
 public static void removeListener(KawaEventListener listener)
Remove a KawaEventListener from the list of listeners.

Parameters:
listener - An existing File listener
getListenersCount 
 public static int getListenersCount()
Return the number of current listeners on KawaFile.
